description: Milk some [PINE NUTS]?  Not quite, but blend them with water, yes!  A dairy-free alternative strong in calcium!  Rival to [ALL] milk.
Pulp left over after making [PINE] milk.  It's gritty and bland.
Delicious [PINE] nut ambrosia.  A drink worthy of the gods.
A light brown paste that tastes very little like its namesake.  It's not bad, but it'll stick to the roof of your mouth.
A serving of [PINE NUTS] that have been hulled, chopped, and boiled in water before being thoroughly toasted until dry.  Filling and nutritious.
